lines.text:
[Sarcastically to the Prospector]
I never forget a face, young man, but in your case I'll make an exception.

[to the Wife]
Senora, you cook up the pot of tamales. I just peeck up the lid!
I can understand a storm. It's a natural thing not meant to harm anyone, but the violence of men, their cruelty, their savageness... to one another... to themselves!

[Describing finding the dead body]
No, just one look at that face, and I got out of there as fast as I could!

[laughs]
Now, what makes people so jittery about the dead? Why, some of my best friends are corpses... the only ones I can trust! Oh, sure, they stink a little but no more than a few alive ones that I know.
There was a trial.
What happened?
A man was murdered.
Just one? A slow day!
I could have had hundreds women, but for you I take big chance.
Shut up, you! This is a preacher standing here.
Preacher? It can't be! He woke me up. They usually put me to sleep.

[to the Preacher]
Don't pay him no mind.
Who is he?
He's a con man... a swindler... an old scalawag.
How else can a man live to be old nowadays?

[laughing after hearing a description of the corpse]
Ah, hah-hah! I know, I know. You know, they all look so surprised... them cadavers.
[Chuckles]
I bet death must be a lot different than anybody thinks.
Is truth the luxury of the rich?
